### Piche UI

Launched on: https://ui.piche.it/

# How to Test This Package in Another Project

This guide explains how to test **`piche.ui`** inside a different Vite-based project during development.

---

## Option 1 (Build)

### 1. Build Package

**`pnpm build`**
Make sure the dist folder exists — this is what your consuming project will import.

✅ If you make changes to the package, rebuild it before re-testing in the consuming app.

### 2. Navigate to Your Target Project

In the target project, open the **`vite.config.ts`** file and prepare to add alias settings.

```ts
resolve: {
  alias: {
    // add your aliases here
  }
}
```

### 3. Add Alias Configuration

Inside the **`resolve.alias`** section of the config, add the necessary aliases to resolve the local package correctly.
Replace **`your-local-path`** with your own absolute or relative path

```ts
'piche.ui': path.resolve(__dirname, 'your-local-path/piche.ui/dist'),
```

## Option 2 (Real time changes)

### 1. Navigate to Your Target Project

In the target project, open the **`vite.config.ts`** file and prepare to add alias settings.

```ts
resolve: {
  alias: {
    // add your aliases here
  }
}
```

### 2. Add Alias Configuration

Inside the **`resolve.alias`** section of the config, add the necessary aliases to resolve the local package correctly.
Replace **`your-local-path`** with your own absolute or relative path

```ts
'react': path.resolve(__dirname, 'node_modules/react'),
'react-dom': path.resolve(__dirname, 'node_modules/react-dom'),
'piche.ui': path.resolve(__dirname, 'your-local-path/piche.ui/src'),
```
